pages.title: Overview
pages.description: Texas Children's Design System is the single source of truth for web design and front-end development at Texas Children's. It provides a centralized library of web components, design resources, and best practice guidelines, aiming to enhance consistency, standardization, and time-to-launch for web projects at Texas Children's.

pages.title: Installation
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Contributing
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Animation
pages.description: Animation can be used to engage users, focus attention, and enrich experiences with expression and depth. Used improperly, however, it can be distracting and exclusionary.

pages.title: Color
pages.description: Color is used to establish brand identity and create pleasing designs. It can also be used to convey meaning and tone, as well as influence focus and emotion. Used inconsistently or improperly, color can negatively impact user experience or brand integrity.

pages.title: Icons
pages.description: Icons are illustrative aids to enhance understanding, supplement meaning, and reinforce brand tone and style.

pages.title: Logos
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Shape and shadow
pages.description: Box shadows create depth that assists in understanding the layout of an interface. Rounded corners work well aesthetically with box shadows, and reflect the rounded design language of the Texas Children's brand.

pages.title: Typography
pages.description: Good typography communicates ideas clearly and reinforces our brand. To these ends, the Design System provides styles that establish clear visual hierarchy, consistency, and rhythm, while reflecting brand identity and tone.

pages.title: Aspect ratio
pages.description: The Design System provides a set of standard aspect ratios, based on industry standards. Using standard ratios can help with responsive designs by ensuring elements, such as images, videos, containers, and other components, can scale to the window or their container while preserving their intended proportions.

pages.title: Breakpoints
pages.description: The Design System uses a standard set of breakpoints internally, and exposes them externally through a variety of conditional component props and utility classes.

pages.title: Layout design
pages.description: Layouts are designed with grids, flexible distribution, and responsive positioning and sizing.

pages.title: Space and size
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Z-Index
pages.description: An element's z-index controls its stacking context, or how it layers over other elements.

pages.title: Components
pages.description: Components are reusable building blocks for creating pages and interfaces. They are intended to be configurable, content-agnostic, and context-aware, while also being consistent and predictable. Using a component-based approach to building pages and interfaces, you can more quickly and easily deliver consistent, quality-controlled experiences to end users.

pages.title: Accordion
pages.description: Accordions collapse content under headings, allowing users to selectively toggle the content according to their interest.

pages.title: Alert Bar
pages.description: The Alert Bar is a banner located at the top of the page that categorizes alerts, enabling users to explore details or dismiss them as needed.

pages.title: Block quote
pages.description: Block quotes are used to display extended quotations. They are visually highlighted to draw the reader's attention.

pages.title: Button
pages.description: Buttons allow users to trigger an action with a single tap, click, or keypress. They are useful to call attention to some action or to provide controls for an interface or form. Links navigate users to another page, and can be styled to look like buttons.

pages.title: Callout
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Card
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Carousel
pages.description: Carousels rotate through slides of content, allowing users to advance forward or backward, play or pause, and select specific slides from a row of indicator buttons.

pages.title: Quick links

pages.title: Section
pages.description: The Section component creates a boxed container with a full-bleed background and vertical padding, useful for creating distinct sections on landing pages, as well as large introductory sections such as heroes and profile mastheads. Accordingly, it also increases the font size of paragraphs and list items.

pages.title: Separator
pages.description: Separators, also known as horizontal rules (HRs) or dividers, indicate a thematic break between sections of content.

pages.title: Site footer
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Site header
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Submenu
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Tabs
pages.description: Tabs allow users to switch between panels of content from a horizontal list of labels. They enable quick comparison between different pieces of content within the same context and of the same information type.

pages.title: Accessibility
pages.description: Texas Children's is committed to providing intuitive and pleasant digital experiences to users of diverse abilities and backgrounds.

pages.title: Testing
pages.description: Default description

pages.title: Writing accessible content
pages.description: The way text content is written and rendered has significant accessibility implications. It can determine whether users with disabilities have an inclusive and seamless experience or face frustration, exclusion, and usability issues.
